title: Predicting the best, worst scenarios for every NFL team: Who can surpass 10 wins this season?
content: We simulated best-case and worst-case scenarios for every team, and our NFL reporters picked the biggest variables.

title: After hold-in, Bills' Cook gets 4-year, $48M deal
content: Running back James Cook and the Bills have reached agreement on a four-year, $48 million contract extension that includes $30 million guaranteed, his agents told ESPN.

title: Porter Jr.: Betting impact 'going to get worse'
content: Michael Porter Jr., whose brother Jontay was banned from the NBA in 2024 for his role in a gambling scheme, says the expansion of sports betting has detracted from the integrity and enjoyment of the game "and it's only going to get worse."

title: Stefanski disappointed over Garrett speeding
content: Browns coach Kevin Stefanski said he is "extremely" disappointed with Myles Garrett after the star defensive end was cited for speeding last weekend.

title: Halos' Neto turns his 1st triple play off Ohtani liner
content: Zach Neto -- who had never been part of a triple play in the minors, college or even Little League -- helped the Angels turn one Tuesday night off a line drive by Dodgers slugger Shohei Ohtani, before winning in extra innings.

title: 'Game changer': Kansas gets hefty $300M gift
content: Kansas has received an unprecedented $300 million gift from donor David Booth, believed to be among the largest single gifts in the history of college athletics.

title: Rodgers on new helmet: Looks like a 'spaceship'
content: Aaron Rodgers says he doesn't like the helmet he has been wearing this year, saying it "looks like a damn spaceship."

title: Richardson apologizes to boyfriend after arrest
content: Sprinter Sha'Carri Richardson addressed her recent domestic violence arrest in a video on social media and issued an apology to her boyfriend, Christian Coleman.

title: How worried should Mets, Yankees be? ESPN insiders break it down
content: Not long ago, both N.Y. teams seemed to be cruising toward October -- then things took a turn for the worse.

title: How Knicks fans deal with being on MSG's banned list
content: Despite backlash, MSG Entertainment's "attorney exclusion list" is still in effect, reportedly banning over a thousand lawyers since 2022.

title: After suffering a catastrophic injury, can UNC quarterback Max Johnson get his career back on track?
content: The son of Brad Johnson is entering his sixth year of college after rehabbing a broken leg, still hoping that he can play his way into the NFL draft.

title: Fantasy Football Marathon mock draft: 'Big 4' quarterbacks all go in Round 3
content: The annual event concluded with a 10-team mock, during which two tight ends were drafted before the first quarterback was taken.

title: Barnwell: How Jerry Jones' bungled contract negotiations cost the Cowboys $100 million
content: What are the Cowboys doing?!? The Micah Parsons situation is just the latest in a line of costly mistakes.

title: 10 biggest WNBA games that will determine the 2025 playoff race
content: From a Lynx-Liberty showdown to the Sept. 11 regular-season finale, these are the most impactful WNBA games left.

title: 11 second-year players who could break out this season
content: These super sophomores could make a significant impact, including on the College Football Playoff race.

title: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 23 five-stars in the class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: Lurking concerns for top 10 NBA contenders for the 2025-26 season
content: These 10 NBA franchises have the best chance to capture the NBA title. What hurdles will they have to overcome to raise the Larry O'Brien Trophy?

title: Rankings: Eric Moody's QB tiers
content: Creating your own rankings tiers is an essential part of the draft prep process. Eric Moody provides his quarterbacks tiers to give you a head start.

title: Taylor Swift to join Travis Kelce on 'New Heights,' reveals new album
content: After a teaser post with a Taylor Swift-shaped silhouette fueled rumors, it was confirmed that the pop star will make her first appearance on the Kelce brothers' podcast.

title: LaLiga questions: Barcelona-Madrid title race; Mbappé vs. Yamal
content: The new LaLiga season is upon us! Will Barcelona and Real Madrid dominate? Will Atlético spoil the party? Will Mbappé or Yamal shine brightest?

title: Coach? Star? Captain? All gone. Leverkusen's rebuild is total
content: A year after wining the Bundesliga, Leverkusen are rebuilding without their genius coach and star players.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool agree deal with defender Leoni
content: Liverpool have verbally agreed to personal terms with Parma defender Giovanni Leoni. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Venmo requests and death threats: Heckling in the digital sports betting age
content: Being an athlete in the public eye can have its perks, but also many challenges. The most recent one? Bettors requesting money if they aren't getting the wins.

title: UConn offers stadium suite as part of fantasy football draft hosting package
content: At $75 per person, the Rentschler Field draft experience will get you a catered suite, locker room tour and more.

title: Top Court Orders EVM Recount, Overturns Sarpanch Elections In Haryana
content: The Supreme Court has overturned the election of the Sarpanch of Gram Panchayat Buana Lakhu in Haryana's Panipat district after a court-monitored recount found the appellant securing the highest number of votes.

title: Can Impose Sanctions On Iran If No Solution By Month-End: European Nations
content: Britain, France and Germany have told the United Nations they are ready to reimpose UN-mandated sanctions on Iran over its nuclear programme if no diplomatic solution is found by the end of August, according to a joint letter released Wednesday.

title: UP Man Arrested For Running Rs 6-Crore Online Scam Via Social Media
content: The Delhi Police has apprehended a B.Tech graduate from Greater Noida, Uttar Pradesh, for allegedly running a Rs 6.03-crore online investment scam that duped victims via social media, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Order In Place Since 1988: Devendra Fadnavis On Row Over Independence Day Meat Ban
content: Breaking his silence after a furore over some civic bodies in Maharashtra asking meat shops and slaughterhouses to remain shut on Independence Day, Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis has said the order is not new and has been in place since 1988.

title: Inside The Mine That Fuels Tech World, Funds Congo's rebels
content: Under the watchful eye of M23 rebels in the hills around the Congolese town of Rubaya, a line of men in rubber boots ferry sacks full of crushed rocks up winding paths cut into the slopes.

title: "US Tariff Impact Will Ease In 1-2 Quarters": Chief Economic Advisor
content: Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran on Wednesday said US tariffs-related challenges will dissipate in the next one or two quarters, and urged the private sector to do more as the country navigates through other longer-term challenges.

title: Rahul Gandhi Claims Threat To Life, Quotes Comments By BJP Leaders In Savarkar Case
content: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi has alleged some BJP MPs threatened him he would "meet the same fate" as his grandmother, former prime minister Indira Gandhi, for his remarks against Vinayak Damodar Savarkar during the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in 2022.

title: AAP Slams Centre For Shielding Vote Fraud, BJP Says "Baseless Accusations"
content: The Aam Aadmi Party on Tuesday alleged that the BJP-led central government was avoiding discussion in Parliament on the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls to hide its role in large-scale vote manipulation.

title: Bombay High Court Okays Expert Panel On Pigeon Row, Halts Civic Body's Controlled Feeding Plan
content: The Bombay High Court on Wednesday directed the formation of an expert committee to examine the pigeon-feeding controversy, while putting the brakes on the proposal of the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) to allow "controlled feeding".

title: Ahead Of Alaska Summit, Russia Makes Biggest Advance In Ukraine In Over A Year
content: The Russian army made its biggest 24-hour advance into Ukraine in over a year on Tuesday just ahead of the Trump-Putin summit, according to an AFP analysis of data from the US-based Institute for the Study of War.

title: "Killed 2,800 Dogs, Can Go To Jail If Needed": Shocker From Karnataka Leader
content: A leader from HD Kumaraswamy's Janata Dal Secular has admitted to killing 2800 dogs to ensure "the safety of children".

title: Opinion: Opinion | US-Israel Are Standing Alone. Their Friends Want To 'Recognise' Palestine
content: Australia has now joined a growing bloc of Western nations, including the UK, France, Spain, Ireland and Canada, that have declared their intention to recognise the State of Palestine.

title: Exclusive: DRDO Guest House Manager Was Spying On Top Scientists For Pak
content: A 32-year-old man working as a manager at a Defence Research and Development Organisation or DRDO guest house in Jaisalmer was arrested Wednesday for allegedly spying for Pakistan.

title: Canada To Reset Express Entry Categories For 2026. What It Means For Indian Students
content: The Canadian government is set to add three new occupational categories to expand its Express Entry immigration system in 2026. The new occupational categories would be senior managers, scientists and researchers, and military personnel.

title: Soaring To New Heights, Swiss Pilot Surpasses Solar-Powered Plane Altitude Record
content: Swiss pilot Raphael Domjan beat the altitude record for a solar-powered electric plane in a flight that took him soaring to 9,521 metres, his team announced Wednesday.

title: Remove Sanitation Workers Protesting Outside Chennai Civic Body HQ: High Court
content: The Madras High Court on Wednesday directed the Tamil Nadu government to remove sanitation workers who have been staging a protest outside the Greater Chennai Corporation headquarters for the past 13 days against the move to pri

title: Here's Why UK Police Will Now Share Suspects' Ethnicity In Sensitive Cases
content: British police have been told they can release details of a suspect's ethnicity and nationality in high-profile and sensitive cases to prevent false information being spread on social media.

title: The Case That Protects The Press, And Why Trump Hates It
content: President Donald Trump is again attacking the American press - this time not with fiery rally speeches or by calling the media "the enemy of the people," but through the courts.

title: 'Ask Pakistan': US Refuses To Answer If Pak Lost F-16s During Op Sindoor
content: The US government has refused to answer specific queries on the loss of Pakistan Air Force-operated F-16 fighter jets during Op Sindoor, the intense 88-hour battle fought by India and Pakistan between May 7 and May 10.

title: Why Perplexity, Valued At $18 Billion, Made $34.5 Billion Offer For Chrome
content: Perplexity AI has made an unsolicited offer to acquire Google's Chrome browser for $34.5 billion, a price tag nearly double its own valuation.

title: SC order on Delhi stray dogs: CJI refers matter to 3-judge bench; hearing tomorrow
content: On August 11, a bench of Justices Pardiwala and R Mahadevan took a stern view of the stray dog menace and ordered the Delhi-NCR to start removing stray dogs from all localities within eight weeks and house them in dedicated dog shelters to be set up by civic authorities.​​​

title: 'History must not ...': Rahul says 'may face harm' in Savarkar case; cites complainant's Godse link
content: Rahul Gandhi, facing a defamation case in Pune over his remarks against Savarkar, has expressed security concerns in court. Gandhi's application cites the complainant's lineage as a descendant of Nathuram Godse, raising fears of potential harm or targeting. The defamation case was filed by Satyaki Savarkar, disputing Gandhi's claim about an incident in Savarkar's writings.

title: ‘Reprehensible act’: Indian temple in US vandalised; consulate seeks probe
content: The BAPS Swaminarayan Temple in Greenwood, Indiana, was vandalized, drawing strong condemnation from the Indian Consulate in Chicago, who have urged law enforcement to take swift action. This incident follows a similar act of vandalism at a BAPS temple in Chino Hills, California, less than six months ago.

title: Asia Cup | Shubman Gill - BCCI's new poster boy should lead India in T20Is too
content: With Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma all but retired, the BCCI’s search for a new on-field leader and marketable face has turned to Shubman Gill. Already India’s Test captain, his growing brand value, T20I record, and leadership credentials make him a strong contender for the white-ball captaincy as well.

title: Perplexity, itself valued at $18 billion, offers $34.5 billion for Google Chrome
content: Perplexity, an AI search startup, has made a bold $34.5 billion all-cash offer to acquire Google's Chrome browser, aiming to challenge Google's search dominance. This move comes as Google faces antitrust pressure to divest Chrome. Perplexity pledges significant investment in Chrome's development and open-source nature, while maintaining user choice and continuity.

title: Watch: Rohit Sharma's dance moves with wife go viral amid ODI ranking surge
content: Rohit Sharma, India's ODI captain, is trending due to a viral video showcasing his dance moves with wife Ritika Sajdeh at her brother's wedding in 2023. Despite being on a break after the 2025 IPL season, Rohit has climbed to No. 2 in the ICC ODI rankings, surpassing Babar Azam.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on nepotism: Parents wouldn't recommend their kids if ...
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang defended the company's hiring practices, addressing concerns about nepotism by stating that parents wouldn't recommend their children if they weren't capable. His comments come as his own children, Madison and Spencer, have risen to prominent positions in emerging business divisions, despite initial career paths outside of technology. Both siblings have reportedly exceeded targets in their roles.

title: 'If they are saying so much to Sachin …': When Dravid took a cheeky dig at crowd criticism
content: RP Singh recently shared a humorous anecdote from 1999, revealing Rahul Dravid's witty side. During a Ranji Trophy match where Dravid scored 199, they watched Sachin Tendulkar bat in an India match. Tendulkar's run-a-ball innings prompted some criticism, leading Dravid to quip about the potential reactions to his own, more measured, batting approach.

title: 'I've lost Virat, Rohit, Dhoni's numbers': Ashwin shares 'scam' story
content: A man in Chhattisgarh unexpectedly received calls from cricket stars like Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers after purchasing a SIM card previously used by Rajat Patidar. This incident prompted Ravichandran Ashwin to share a story about a scammer impersonating Devon Conway, highlighting the importance of protecting personal information, especially for high-profile cricketers, in the digital age.

title: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke: There is no world where I would allow employees to say...
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke mandated the use of the platform for all employees, emphasizing its integral role in the company culture. Under his leadership, GitHub experienced significant growth, particularly with AI-powered development tools like GitHub Copilot. However, Dohmke has recently resigned to pursue entrepreneurial ventures, leading to GitHub's integration into Microsoft's CoreAI team by the end of 2025.

title: 'Unconstitutional, violates rights': Owaisi slams Hyderabad meat ban on Independence Day
content: Asaduddin Owaisi, president of AIMIM, has criticised the Hyderabad Municipal Corporation's order to close meat shops and slaughterhouses on Independence Day. Owaisi argues that the ban infringes upon citizens' rights to liberty, privacy, livelihood, culture, nutrition, and religion, questioning the connection between eating meat and celebrating independence.

title: 'No cricket tours to Pak ...': Govt outlines authority over India’s participation
content: India's National Sports Governance Bill, a landmark reform, is set for implementation within six months, according to Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya. The bill establishes the National Sports Board and Tribunal, aiming for enhanced accountability. It grants the government power to restrict international participation in extraordinary circumstances, citing national security or global emergencies.

title: 'Anti-Tamil Nadu activities': Cong to boycott governor Ravi's Independence Day tea party
content: The Tamil Nadu Congress has announced a boycott of Governor R.N. Ravi's Independence Day tea party, citing his "anti-Tamil Nadu activities," including the rejection of a bill to establish a university named after former chief minister M Karunanidhi. The party also protests the Election Commission's voter list revision in Bihar.

title: Exclusive - Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah to finally welcome a new Rajasthani family
content: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah is set to introduce a new family to Gokuldham Society after 17 years, aiming to maintain its high entertainment value. Exclusive photos from the set reveal a Rajasthani family of four arriving on camels, hinting at a cultural twist.

title: Cong rallies behind Priyanka Gandhi, slams Israeli envoy’s ‘undiplomatic’ attack
content: Senior Congress leaders have strongly condemned Israeli Ambassador Reuven Azar's public criticism of Priyanka Gandhi Vadra regarding her statements on the Gaza situation. They described Azar's remarks as "unprecedented" and "intolerable," accusing him of a "brazen denial" of the humanitarian crisis.

title: ‘Coolie’ first review: Udhayanidhi Stalin hails Rajinikanth’s 50 years in cinema
content: Udhayanidhi Stalin congratulated Rajinikanth on his 50th year in film and praised 'Coolie' after a preview. He lauded the film as a power-packed entertainer, anticipating global success. Stalin extended wishes to the cast and crew, including Nagarjuna, Sathyaraj, Aamir Khan, and Shruti Haasan, heightening anticipation for the film's release in over 100 countries.

title: Wilson's wife Ciara first descendant of enslaved Africans to get Benin citizenship under new law
content: Ciara, the Grammy-winning singer, has made history by becoming one of the first to receive Beninese citizenship through a program aimed at reconnecting descendants of enslaved Africans. This initiative seeks to heal historical wounds and strengthen ties with the Black diaspora. Benin's efforts carry significant weight due to its role in the transatlantic slave trade.

title: Tragic shocker! Para-athlete dies after rabid dog attack
content: In a tragic incident, para-athlete Jogendra Chhatria and Hrusikesh Rana succumbed to rabies 19 days after being bitten by a stray dog in Balangir district. Despite receiving anti-rabies vaccinations, their condition worsened, leading to their deaths. The incident has sparked outrage in the village, prompting calls for action against rabid dogs.

title: Top 5 entertainment news: FIRST reviews of War 2; Akshay Kumar's car seized in Jammu
content: Bollywood is buzzing with news! Early reviews are calling "War 2" a potential blockbuster, while Akshay Kumar faced a traffic violation in Jammu. Boney Kapoor remembered Sridevi on her birth anniversary, and YouTuber Armaan Malik faces legal trouble. Mrunal Thakur responded to criticism and clarified relationship rumors, keeping the entertainment world on its toes.

title: Stray dog order: How world tackles strays — from sterilisation drives to euthanasia
content: Amid rising stray dog bites, the Supreme Court has ordered the removal of all stray dogs in Delhi-NCR to shelters, banning their return to the streets. The order warns of strict action against obstruction. Globally, effective strategies include universal microchipping, large-scale CNVR/TNVR programs, rabies control, adoption pipelines, and abandonment enforcement.

title: ‘Evidence of crime’: Congress challenges BJP over Sonia Gandhi voter ID claim
content: The Congress party is demanding that the BJP provide evidence to support claims that Sonia Gandhi possessed a voter ID before becoming an Indian citizen. Pawan Khera also requested result data from the Varanasi constituency, questioning PM Modi's victory margin.

title: WATCH: 'Only thing I can do with broken foot … ' — Rishabh Pant turns chef
content: Rishabh Pant, currently sidelined with a fractured right foot sustained during the England Test series, is keeping his spirits high by indulging in pizza baking. He shared a light-hearted video on social media, showcasing his culinary skills while humorously acknowledging his lack of cooking at home. Pant's playful attitude and pizza-making adventures are keeping him busy during his recovery.

title: Jaishankar to visit Russia, hold talks with Lavrov amid tension with US
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will meet Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on August 21. This meeting follows increased tariffs imposed by the US on Indian imports. National Security Advisor Ajit Doval recently met Russian President Vladimir Putin. Discussions during that meeting were not disclosed. Putin is expected to visit India before the end of 2025.

title: Yuzvendra Chahal's estranged wife Dhanashree Verma dances with Big Boss winner - WATCH
content: Indian cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal's divorce from Dhanashree Verma was finalized on March 20, 2025, in Mumbai. The event grabbed attention when Chahal arrived at the family court wearing a T-shirt that read, “Be Your Own Sugar Daddy.

title: When India pulled out of Asia Cup — And the big story behind it
content: The 2025 Asia Cup will be held in the UAE from September 9-28, featuring eight teams in the T20I format. India's participation was initially uncertain due to strained relations with Pakistan, but the BCCI has confirmed their presence. India will play Pakistan in a high-profile match on September 14, with potential for multiple encounters throughout the tournament.

title: KBC17 promo: Women officers share courageous stories from Op Sindoor
content: Kaun Banega Crorepati 17's Independence Day special will feature three inspiring women officers: Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, Wing Commander Vyomika Singh, and Commander Prerna Deosthalee. A promo reveals their experiences from Operation Sindoor, highlighting the importance of responding to Pakistan's actions. The episode, airing August 15th, has generated excitement, with viewers eager to witness the officers' courage and insights.

title: Journalists’ articles, videos prima facie not sedition: SC
content: The Supreme Court has shielded 'The Wire' editor Siddharth Varadarajan from arrest under Section 152 of the BNS, cautioning against implicating journalists for news articles. Justices emphasized that a news report doesn't inherently threaten national unity, even while hearing a case against the validity of Section 152.

title: Travis Kelce’s dad praises Taylor Swift’s The Life of a Showgirl: ‘It’s going to be beautiful’
content: Taylor Swift revealed her new album, *The Life of a Showgirl*, on the *New Heights* podcast, hosted by Travis and Jason Kelce, surprising even Ed Kelce. Swift has been working on the album in LA after securing the rights to her first six albums.

title: 'In any serious nation ...': Op Sindoor heroes to feature on TV show; opposition objects
content: Opposition parties in India have criticized the appearance of three military officers from Operation Sindoor on a television program. The officers were featured on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati', an entertainment show. Concerns were raised about the appropriateness of discussing a military operation on a private entertainment platform.

title: Delhi stray dog crackdown: 700 caught near Red Fort
content: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi is initiating a phased approach to manage the city's stray dog population, following a Supreme Court order. Aggressive and diseased dogs are being removed from specific areas, with plans to intensify efforts post-Independence Day.

title: India to boycott Pakistan in Asia Cup? 'Khoon aur paani ek saath nahi beh sakte'
content: India spin legend Harbhajan Singh has strongly advocated for India to boycott Pakistan matches in the upcoming Asia Cup, echoing the sentiment of 'nation first.' He highlights the sacrifices of soldiers on the border and questions the importance given to Pakistan by the media. Harbhajan was part of the India Champions team that refused to play Pakistan in the WCL.

title: Not just Rohit! Ex-India pacer says he's also been called George Clooney
content: RP Singh reminisced about the electrifying celebrations following India's 2007 T20 World Cup victory, highlighting the unforgettable Mumbai parade. He also shared an anecdote involving Rahul Dravid during a Ranji Trophy match, illustrating the pressures faced by even the greatest batsmen. Singh humorously recounted instances of being mistaken for Rohit Sharma and even George Clooney.

title: Another Indian attacked in Ireland: Man assaulted by teenagers; receives 8 stitches
content: An Indian national in Dublin was recently assaulted by a group of teenagers in Fairview Park, prompting him to return to India. The victim recounted being kicked and beaten, with bystanders failing to intervene until two teenagers aided him and alerted the police.

title: UP shocker: Aunt gouges out 12-year-old’s eye for ‘dropping’ infant
content: In Agra, a 12-year-old girl suffered permanent vision loss in one eye after her aunt allegedly attacked her with a steel hairband. The incident occurred when the girl accidentally dropped the aunt's infant daughter. Police have registered a case against the aunt, while the girl receives treatment at AIIMS Delhi, with her father alleging that police diluted the charges.

title: Assam: 14 police personnel injured after mob attack in Hojai; at least 7 arrested
content: ​​At least 14 police personnel were injured after a mob attacked a police team and damaged police vehicles in Assam’s Hojai district on Tuesday, August 12. The incident took place in the Digholbali area, news agency ANI reported.

title: Drunk man beaten to death after he claims he ‘killed’ child; kid’s killer held in 2019
content: In Chhattisgarh's Sakti district, a 45-year-old man, Surve Das Mahant, was beaten to death after drunkenly claiming responsibility for a 2019 murder for which a juvenile had already been convicted. Enraged villagers stripped and assaulted Mahant, who had a history of petty crime, after he argued with relatives and confessed to killing their child.

title: Bermuda Triangle ‘mystery’ solved? Scientist explains the real cause
content: The Bermuda Triangle's infamous reputation for unexplained disappearances is largely unfounded, according to scientist Karl Kruszelnicki and supported by NOAA and Lloyd's of London. The region's high traffic volume, combined with challenging environmental conditions like the Gulf Stream and frequent storms, accounts for the incidents. Human error and equipment failure also play significant roles, debunking myths of supernatural forces.

title: Exclusion of Aadhaar from Bihar SIR: SC observes 11 docs more 'voter friendly' than 7
content: The Supreme Court has observed that the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) in Bihar, requiring 11 documents, is more voter-friendly than the previous summary revision's seven. Despite arguments against excluding Aadhaar, the court highlighted the inclusionary nature of the extensive document list. Petitioners, however, argued that the documents have limited coverage among the population, citing low passport ownership.

title: AIIMS exodus: 429 doctors quit 20 institutes in 2 years
content: A significant number of doctors, 429, have resigned from 20 AIIMS institutions between 2022 and 2024, with AIIMS Delhi experiencing the highest number of departures. This exodus coincides with a critical shortage of faculty, as nearly one-third of faculty positions remain vacant across all AIIMS.

title: A.P. CM calls for urgent flood precautions in view of heavy rain
content: Emphasising efficient use of the heavy inflows, Naidu orders diversion of up to four tmc ft of floodwater daily to Somasila and Kandaleru reservoirs

title: Nipah survivor from Mangaluru in coma at Kozhikode hospital to get ₹17 lakh from CMDRF
content: He had initially contracted the infection while attending to a patient during the 2023 outbreak in Kozhikode

title: Don’t burden consumers with tariff hike, Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu directs power utilities in Andhra Pradesh
content: Alternatively, the Chief Minister wants officials to tap potential of non-tariff revenue streams such as leasing AP-Transco’s fiber optic network to generate ₹7,000 crore; he also calls for reduction in power purchases from the open market and bringing down T&D losses

title: Mega protest in Hubballi on Sunday against efforts to defame Dharmasthala
content: They condemn defamation campaign by some vested interests against Dharmashthala and Dharmadhikari D. Veerendra Heggade

title: Stormwater master plan to be prepared for Telangana Core Urban Region
content: While the stormwater drains within GHMC have been enumerated multiple times through various consultants, the TCUR has not been included in the mapping

title: Bronze statues of 18th century warrior brothers of T.N. inaugurated in Chittoor
content: Brothers Periya Marudhu and Chinna Marudhu are revered as the first freedom fighters who waged a battle against the British East India Company

title: Suresh Gopi maintains silence on voter list discrepancies as protests by BJP, CPI(M) rock Thrissur
content: Union Minister visits injured party workers but skips BJP protest march; CPI(M), AIYF too take out marches. CPI State Council member K.K. Valsaraj accuses the Centre of using its influence to dismantle the democratic election process

title: Jagan demands fresh ZPTC by-elections under watch of Central forces
content: He terms the August 12 bypolls a mockery of democracy, marred by large-scale rigging and police bias; questioning the Congress’s silence on the goings-on in Andhra Pradesh, he alleges a nexus between Rahul Gandhi and Chandrababu Naidu

title: Rahul tells Pune court he might face harm from followers of Savarkar and Godse
content: The case, the trial of which is yet to start, pertains to certain comments allegedly made by Rahul Gandhi against V.D. Savarkar, freedom fighter and Hindutva ideologue.

title: Institutions advised against observing Partition horror day
content: Higher Education Minister R. Bindu told mediapersons on Wednesday that official instructions have been issued through the Directorate of Collegiate Education and the Directorate of Technical Education.

title: Protest staged in Yadgir demanding action against attempts to defame Dharmasthala
content: Hundreds of devotees and followers take out a protest march, shout slogans against social media videos containing false information and fake news

title: 79th I-Day celebrations at Manekshaw Parade Ground to feature 35 police contingents
content: The event will witness a performance by 650 children commemorating the women from Karnataka who took part in the freedom struggle

title: Balakrishna launches Amaravati campus works of Basavatarakam Cancer Hospital
content: Hindupur MLA says 1,000-bed Centre of Excellence for cancer care to come up in two phases on 21 acres at Thullur, with first 500-bed facility set to be operational by 2028 at a cost of ₹750 crore

title: Maharashtra government not interested in regulating people's food choices: CM Fadnavis
content: NMC Deputy Commissioner of the Solid Waste Management Department Rajesh Bhagat issued the order on August 12, stating that on the occasion of Independence Day and Janmashtami on August 15, 2025, all slaughterhouses and meat shops in the city will remain shut

title: Rahul Gandhi has tea with 'dead' voters from Bihar, thanks ECI for experience
content: The group also told Mr. Gandhi that they appeared before the Supreme Court to get their voting rights back

title: Vachananand Swami favours uniform quota for all Veerashaiva Lingayat sub-sects
content: The seer of the Veerashaiva Lingayat Panchamasali Jagadguru Peetha sees the need for the policy as only then they will feel being one

title: Centre working on multi-Ministry export promotion scheme to counter Trump tariff impact
content: Tariff-hit sectors such as textiles and chemicals to become new focus of existing scheme announced in the last Budget; MSME exporters to get credit guarantees, speedy clearances, and export incentives

title: Proposal for Kottayam-Ernakulam spur road gains momentum with submission of draft report to Union government
content: Proposed 60-km stretch will begin at Mulankuzha in Kottayam, along MC Road, and pass through Kumarakom and Vaikom before reaching Tripunithura, where it will connect to the Angamaly-Kundannoor bypass

title: Manickam Tagore hits out at Jagan for his remarks against Rahul Gandhi on ‘vote-chori’ campaign
content: Unlike the YSRCP chief, Rahul has not surrendered to Amit Shah, nor is he afraid of Narendra Modi, the AICC in-charge for A.P. affairs says, and dares Jagan to join the march proposed in Vijayawada by the Congress on the issue on August 14

title: INS asks State government to withdraw order challenging media freedom
content: The government order in this regard empowers an investigating officer to summon documents for examination

title: Relocate stray dogs from Bengaluru city, say Opposition members
content: The Opposition members on Wednesday has drawn the attention of the State government on the increased number of dog-bite cases in Bengaluru city and demanded immediate action to relocate all stray dogs

title: Sanitary waste processing plant opened in Varkala municipality
content: The plant, with a capacity to process five tonnes of waste daily, is also the first medium scale plant in the State with waste-to-energy conversion capabilities with a capacity to produce 60 KW of electricity

title: SEBI to define algo trading, revamp stock brokers' rules
content: SEBI proposed granting stock brokers access to the Negotiated Dealing System, Order Matching (NDS-OM) platform

title: Bill passed to relax conversion of agricultural land up to two acres for industrial use
content: At present, any person holding agricultural land must apply to the Deputy Commissioner for permission to divert it for non-agricultural use, as per Karnataka Land Revenue Act

title: MBU builds ₹30 crore ‘container stadium’ in Tirupati
content: The facility, which has been constructed over a period of four years, has helped avoid an estimated 1,500 tonnes of carbon emissions by using upcycled shipping containers instead of the traditional cement and steel construction

title: Kerala’s best woman farmer cultivates a haven of biodiversity in Alappuzha
content: Practising natural eco-farming for the past 16 years, Ms. Vani is also an organic agripreneur, traditional seed conservator, and climate resilience advocate

title: Supreme Court issues notices on ‘blocking’ of Sakshi TV channel
content: Indira Television Limited alleges disconnection of the channel by APSFL and nearly all MSOs without notice

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: DRDO Jaisalmer guest house manager caught spying for Pakistan, arrested
content: The accused had access to details regarding the visit of Indian scientists and DRDO officers to the firing range for various technical operations, including missile trials

title: Conservancy workers will get higher pay from private employer: Chennai Corporation Commissioner tells Madras High Court
content: Justice K. Surender reserves orders on two writ petitions seeking to quash the civic body’s resolutions for outsourcing sanitary work in Royapuram and Thiru. Vi. Ka. Nagar zones

title: ZPTC by-election: re-polling peaceful in Pulivendula
content: It has been conducted in two polling stations amid tight security; counting of votes for the Pulivendula and Ontimitta seats today

title: Bengaluru private hospital successfully treats three-year-old with rare genetic condition
content: The boy was brought earlier this year to Rainbow Children’s Hospital at Bannerghatta Road in Bengaluru, with fever, tachypnea, and profound dyspnea.

title: Six-year-old child from Ghana undergoes open heart surgery at Jayadeva institute in Bengaluru
content: With lack of adequate facilities in Ghana for such complex heart surgery, the parents were advised to take the child to Jayadeva institute

title: Preparation for Independence Day 2025 celebrations in Bengaluru
content: Rains disrupted preparations for Independence Day 2025 celebrations in Bengaluru on August 13, 2025.

title: Resignation only option before Justice Varma to avoid removal by Parliament, rules say
content: Should he decide to resign, he will get a pension and other benefits entitled to a retired high court judge, but if he is removed by Parliament, he will be deprived of pension and other benefits, they noted.

title: Transport department employees’ union warns of Statewide stir from August 27 over pending dues, land row
content: Union leaders cite unpaid benefits, stalled promotions, and transfer of ₹400-cr Vijayawada land to LuLu Group; gives government deadline till Vinayaka Chaviti

title: CCB files charge sheet in DGP Om Prakash murder case, daughter’s name excluded
content: The victim’s wife, Pallavi, has been accused of stabbing him to death over a property dispute at their house on April 20, 2025.

title: Two feared drowned in Krishna river in Guntur district; search operation on
content: District administration launches rescue efforts as heavy rains inundate parts of Guntur; schools in vulnerable areas told to close temporarily

title: Enforcement Directorate conducts fresh raids in Bihar illegal liquor smuggling case
content: Enforcement Directorate conducts searches in multiple states under PMLA linked to illegal liquor smuggling case, assets attached

title: Mumbai 26/11 attack: Delhi court allows Tahawwur Rana three phone calls with relatives
content: According to the sources, the judge said the phone calls by Rana will be recorded and the conversations will have to be in English or Hindi in the presence of prison authorities

title: 'Champs' to 'Legacy': Kiyan Anthony remixes Carmelo's iconic Syracuse image in ink
content: carmelo Anthony's son, Kiyan, tattooed an image of his dad after he won the national title . in the original image, Carmelo held up a newspaper with a giant headline of "Champs" in place of his father . "it's surreal to see, honestly," a post shared by sportsCenter NEXT .

title: ✈️ Air Force reveals new F-16 fighter uniforms
content: the air force Falcons unveil its 2025 " Air Power Legacy Series" threads . the helmet is similar to that of a fighter jet . it is also displayed as a tribute to col. William Andrews, who used the word as call sign .

title: Watch: Thai teen brutally thrashes female teacher over 2 marks
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Oneil Cruz hurt; Orioles shut down multiple pitchers
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . oneil Cruz left Tuesday's game after bumping heads with Jack Suwinski . he was replaced by a pinch hitter in the sixth inning .

title: Has Sanchez passed Skenes for NL Cy Young? Judge or Raleigh for AL MVP? Latest on all of MLB's award races
content: this month's awards watch reflects changes atop some races and separation in others . the two methods of tracking these things are in complete accord when it comes to anointing the current favorites . a lot can and will change in short period of time in a big league baseball season .

title: 'He's the heartbeat of the team': Why Terry McLaurin, Commanders can't get a deal done
content: wide receiver Terry McLaurin bounded out of the team's facility two weeks ago . he entered the final season of a three-year deal he signed in 2022 . his mood mirrored what the commanders have insisted about him .

title: Ranking the top 50 players in baseball right now: MLB Rank 2025 in-season update
content: a week into the 2025 MLB season, we created our annual MLB Rank list . we asked 17 experts to give their ranking of the top 50 players in the sport this season . based on their overall impact on the season, the list features the MVPs and Cy Young Award winners you'd expect .

title: 2025 Fantasy Football Draft Guide: Rankings, mock drafts and analysis
content: this draft guide will serve as one-stop shop for all of our best fantasy football picks possible in every draft you're in . we have everything needed to help you draft a great team and start the season with a shot . it doesn't matter whether you have been doing this for years or are a first-timer .

title: Tracking NFL preseason holdouts, hold-ins: What's the latest?
content: there are a handful of stars still not practicing due to their contract situations . the start of training camps brought these negotiations to a head . players can hold out and stay away from camp until their financial situations are addressed . they can report to camp to avoid fines but skip practice while waiting for new contract .

title: Borz is back: Why Khamzat Chimaev is only now fighting for a UFC title
content: new: "Borz" isn't thinking about any of that, but right now, he's not thinking about anything . new: he is preparing lunch at the camp, but today's itinerary has been thrown . he will fight for a title on august 19 at 10 p.m. ET on PPV .

title: Turn it up to 11: Brewers hammer Skenes, Pirates
content: the Brewers crush five home runs in a 14-0 win over the Pittsburgh Pirates . the ace right-hander is one of the most dominant pitchers in baseball this season . his 11-game winning streak is their second of the season and the second longest in franchise history . they are the first national league team to accomplish the feat .
